translations: n．发出咆哮声的人或物；（美国俚语）装啤酒的大瓶子，通常容量为64盎司。
· He filled up a couple of growlers at the brewery.
他在酿酒厂装满了几个大瓶子啤酒。

sentences.sentence: Growlers are capable of not only finding and disrupting anti-aircraft radar, but also jamming enemy communications.
sentences.translation: Growler不但能够发现和干扰防空雷达，而且能够扰乱敌人的通信。

sentences.sentence: Prow and bouldered sea slugged it out all night, a clattering succession of growlers and bergy bits nudged aside, slowly but surely.
sentences.translation: 船整夜都在浮冰中航行，船侧发出接连的咔哒声，缓慢而清晰。

sentences.sentence: As we buzzed north, following the coast, white dots appeared in the water: first growlers, then small icebergs, and at last a mush of half-melted sea ice.
sentences.translation: 当我们急忙沿着海湾向北时，水中出现了小白点。 先映入眼帘的是冰山残片，接着是小冰山，最后，是一滩半融化的海冰。
